DOC.brief_summary: This study compare effectiveness individual versus interpersonal psychotherapy treat depressed woman history sexual abuse .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Two Psychotherapy Treatments Depressed Women With History Sexual Abuse
DOC.detailed_description: Depression common serious mental disorder affect million people year . Depression severely impact people 's life , cause often feel sad hopeless , well affect people 's sleep pattern , concentration , energy level . Women history abuse increase risk develop symptom depression . However , treatment interpersonal psychotherapy individual psychotherapy know reduce symptom depression . This study compare effectiveness individual interpersonal psychotherapy improve depressive symptom daily function depressed woman history sexual abuse . Participants study undergo two-part screening interview Strong Adult Ambulatory Clinic . This screen include write questionnaires face-to-face interview regard experience sexual physical abuse ; suicidal thought ; family relationship ; current attitude , thought , feeling . Participants meet criterion randomly assign receive one two treatment : interpersonal psychotherapy individual psychotherapy , consider usual care . All treatment session hold Strong Adult Ambulatory Clinic . Participants assign receive interpersonal psychotherapy attend weekly 50-minute session therapist . Interpersonal psychotherapy focus current interpersonal stressor daily life , difficulty close relationship work . Treatment also help participant examine relationship mood change interpersonal problem . Participants assign receive individual psychotherapy undergo cognitive-behavioral therapy , supportive counseling , combination two . Participants work therapist decide upon treatment plan design help change mood difficulty daily life . The number length treatment session group determine individual basis . For participant , evaluation consist questionnaire similar initial screening complete mid-treatment , post-treatment , 3 month treatment .
DOC.criteria: Meets DSMIV criterion unipolar major depressive disorder History childhood sexual abuse age 18 Seeking outpatient psychotherapy treatment community mental health center Meets DSMIV criterion major depression psychotic feature , bipolar disorder , schizophrenia , mental retardation Active alcohol substance abuse within 3 month study entry date
